AgentState.title: AgentState
AgentState.description:
Representation of an agent's state. This is the state of the agent at a given time, and is persisted in the DB backend. The state has all the information needed to recreate a persisted agent.

Parameters:
    id (str): The unique identifier of the agent.
    name (str): The name of the agent (must be unique to the user).
    created_at (datetime): The datetime the agent was created.
    message_ids (List[str]): The ids of the messages in the agent's in-context memory.
    memory (Memory): The in-context memory of the agent.
    tools (List[str]): The tools used by the agent. This includes any memory editing functions specified in `memory`.
    system (str): The system prompt used by the agent.
    llm_config (LLMConfig): The LLM configuration used by the agent.
    embedding_config (EmbeddingConfig): The embedding configuration used by the agent.

Block.title: Block
Block.description:
A Block represents a reserved section of the LLM's context window which is editable. `Block` objects contained in the `Memory` object, which is able to edit the Block values.

Parameters:
    label (str): The label of the block (e.g. 'human', 'persona'). This defines a category for the block.
    value (str): The value of the block. This is the string that is represented in the context window.
    limit (int): The character limit of the block.
    is_template (bool): Whether the block is a template (e.g. saved human/persona options). Non-template blocks are not stored in the database and are ephemeral, while templated blocks are stored in the database.

    template_name (str): The name of the block template (if it is a template).
    description (str): Description of the block.
    metadata (Dict): Metadata of the block.
    user_id (str): The unique identifier of the user associated with the block.

include_base_tools.title: Include Base Tools
include_base_tools.description: If true, attaches the Letta core tools (e.g. core_memory related functions).

include_multi_agent_tools.title: Include Multi Agent Tools
include_multi_agent_tools.description: If true, attaches the Letta multi-agent tools (e.g. sending a message to another agent).

include_base_tool_rules.title: Include Base Tool Rules
include_base_tool_rules.description: If true, attaches the Letta base tool rules (e.g. deny all tools not explicitly allowed).

include_default_source.title: Include Default Source
include_default_source.description: If true, automatically creates and attaches a default data source for this agent.

model.title: Model
model.description: The LLM configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name, as an alternative to specifying llm_config.

embedding.title: Embedding
embedding.description: The embedding configuration handle used by the agent, specified in the format provider/model-name.

context_window_limit.title: Context Window Limit
context_window_limit.description: The context window limit used by the agent.

embedding_chunk_size.title: Embedding Chunk Size
embedding_chunk_size.description: The embedding chunk size used by the agent.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate, including reasoning step. If not set, the model will use its default value.

max_reasoning_tokens.title: Max Reasoning Tokens
max_reasoning_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate for reasoning step. If not set, the model will use its default value.

enable_reasoner.title: Enable Reasoner
enable_reasoner.description: Whether to enable internal extended thinking step for a reasoner model.

reasoning.title: Reasoning
reasoning.description: Whether to enable reasoning for this agent.

from_template.title: From Template
from_template.description: The template id used to configure the agent

template.title: Template
template.description: Whether the agent is a template

project.title: Project
project.description: Deprecated: Project should now be passed via the X-Project header instead of in the request body. If using the sdk, this can be done via the new x_project field below.

tool_exec_environment_variables.title: Tool Exec Environment Variables
tool_exec_environment_variables.description: The environment variables for tool execution specific to this agent.

memory_variables.title: Memory Variables
memory_variables.description: The variables that should be set for the agent.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The id of the project the agent belongs to.

template_id.title: Template Id
template_id.description: The id of the template the agent belongs to.

base_template_id.title: Base Template Id
base_template_id.description: The base template id of the agent.

identity_ids.title: Identity Ids
identity_ids.description: The ids of the identities associated with this agent.

message_buffer_autoclear.title: Message Buffer Autoclear
message_buffer_autoclear.description: If set to True, the agent will not remember previous messages (though the agent will still retain state via core memory blocks and archival/recall memory). Not recommended unless you have an advanced use case.

enable_sleeptime.title: Enable Sleeptime
enable_sleeptime.description: If set to True, memory management will move to a background agent thread.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: The response format for the agent.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The timezone of the agent (IANA format).

max_files_open.title: Max Files Open
max_files_open.description: Maximum number of files that can be open at once for this agent. Setting this too high may exceed the context window, which will break the agent.

per_file_view_window_char_limit.title: Per File View Window Char Limit
per_file_view_window_char_limit.description: The per-file view window character limit for this agent. Setting this too high may exceed the context window, which will break the agent.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: If set to True, the agent will be hidden.

id.title: Id
id.description: Human-readable identifier for this agent in the file

in_context_message_ids.title: In Context Message Ids
in_context_message_ids.description: List of message IDs that are currently in the agent's context

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: List of messages in the agent's conversation history

files_agents.title: Files Agents
files_agents.description: List of file-agent relationships for this agent

group_ids.title: Group Ids
group_ids.description: List of groups that the agent manages

letta__schemas__agent_file__AgentSchema.title: AgentSchema
letta__schemas__agent_file__AgentSchema.description: Agent with human-readable ID for agent file

type.title: Type
type.description: The message type to be created.

otid.title: Otid
otid.description: The offline threading id associated with this message

sender_id.title: Sender Id
sender_id.description: The id of the sender of the message, can be an identity id or agent id

batch_item_id.title: Batch Item Id
batch_item_id.description: The id of the LLMBatchItem that this message is associated with

group_id.title: Group Id
group_id.description: The multi-agent group that the message was sent in

id.title: Id
id.description: Human-readable identifier for this message in the file

model.title: Model
model.description: The model used to make the function call

agent_id.title: Agent Id
agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent

tool_calls.title: Tool Calls
tool_calls.description: The list of tool calls requested. Only applicable for role assistant.

tool_call_id.title: Tool Call Id
tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call. Only applicable for role tool.

tool_returns.title: Tool Returns
tool_returns.description: Tool execution return information for prior tool calls

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp when the object was created.

letta__schemas__agent_file__MessageSchem.title: MessageSchema
letta__schemas__agent_file__MessageSchem.description: Message with human-readable ID for agent file

id.title: Id
id.description: Human-readable identifier for this tool in the file

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The type of the source code.

source_code.title: Source Code
source_code.description: The source code of the function.

json_schema.title: Json Schema
json_schema.description: The JSON schema of the function.

args_json_schema.title: Args Json Schema
args_json_schema.description: The args JSON schema of the function.

return_char_limit.title: Return Char Limit
return_char_limit.description: The maximum number of characters in the response.

pip_requirements.title: Pip Requirements
pip_requirements.description: Optional list of pip packages required by this tool.

npm_requirements.title: Npm Requirements
npm_requirements.description: Optional list of npm packages required by this tool.

default_requires_approval.title: Default Requires Approval
default_requires_approval.description: Default value for whether or not executing this tool requires approval.

created_by_id.title: Created By Id
created_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

last_updated_by_id.title: Last Updated By Id
last_updated_by_id.description: The id of the user that made this Tool.

metadata_.title: Metadata
metadata_.description: A dictionary of additional metadata for the tool.

letta__schemas__agent_file__ToolSchema.title: ToolSchema
letta__schemas__agent_file__ToolSchema.description: Tool with human-readable ID for agent file

LettaPing.title: LettaPing
LettaPing.description: Ping messages are a keep-alive to prevent SSE streams from timing out during long running requests.
